Recourse Flipset¶

class recourse.flipset.Flipset(x, action_set, solver='cplex', **kwargs)¶

List of actions that will flip the predicted value of a classifier from x

property df¶

Pandas DataFrame representation of Flipset Each row represents a different action to flip the prediction Rows are sorted according to the last arguments passed to the Flipset.sort()

cost: cost of action size: # of altered features features: names of altered variables feature_idx: column indices of altered features x: values of x[j] for j in feature_idx x_new: values of x[j] + a[j]) for j in feature_idx score_new: values of score function at x_new = x + a = w0 + w.dot(x + a) yhat_new: value of prediction at x_new = x + a = f(score_new) feasible: True if x + a is a feasible action flipped: True if the f(x) != f(x+a)

populate(total_items=10, enumeration_type='distinct_subsets', cost_type='local', time_limit=None, node_limit=None, display_flag=None)¶

Generates a list of actions to flip the predicted value of the linear classifier from feature vector x.

Parameters

  • total_items – maximum # of actions to generate set as float(‘inf’) to enumerate all possible actions

  • enumeration_type – enumeration algorithm to use for the flipset must be a string in Flipset.valid_enumeration_types - ‘distinct_subsets’ - ‘mutually_exclusive’

  • cost_type –

    cost function to use for Flipset generation must be a string in Flipset.valid_cost_types

    options include: - local

  • time_limit – max # of seconds to spend before stopping the solver at each iteration

  • node_limit – max # of branch and bound nodes to process before stopping the solver at each iteration

  • display_flag – True to display solver progress during enumeration

Returns

property solutions_info¶

Dictionary representation of Flipset This is a list containing mildly processed output from recourse.builder

sort(**kwargs)¶

Reorders the items in the Flipset dataframe Arguments used to sort are saved :param sort_args: list of fields to use in sort, or arguments passed to pd.DataFrame.sort_values :return:

to_flat_df()¶

Flatten out the actionsets in the flipset to product either a latex or HTML representation.

to_latex(name_formatter='\\textit')¶

converts current Flipset to Latex table :param name_formatter: :return:

view()¶

prints Flipset as Pandas dataframe :return:

property x¶
Returns

feature vector
